TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL .

CARDINAL . The applicant had been a member of the GPE police service since DATE . In DATE he became an employee ( Angestellter ) of the police service of GPE and with effect from DATE was appointed police officer in the capacity of civil servant on probation ( Beamtenverhältnis auf Probe ) .

CARDINAL . On the occasion of a car accident that occurred on DATE while the applicant was on duty , his shoulder and head were injured . The accident was recognised as an occupational accident by the relevant authorities . Due to his injuries the applicant was on sick leave until DATE . From DATE he was certified permanently unfit for service by his doctor .

CARDINAL . By a letter dated DATE the applicant was informed by ORG Polizeipräsidium ) that it was intending to dismiss him from his duties on the ground that he lacked the necessary professional qualifications for his post .
CARDINAL . By a decision of CARDINAL DATE his probationary period was extended until DATE .

CARDINAL . On the basis of a medical expert opinion obtained at the request of ORG on DATE , which established that the applicant was suffering from personality disorders and organic brain damage which were unlikely to be consequences of the said car accident , ORG certified on DATE that the applicant was permanently unfit for the police service and expressed its concerns regarding his appointment as a civil servant for life .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was informed that it was intended to dismiss him from the police service on the ground that he lacked the necessary physical fitness to carry out his duties . The applicant asked for the involvement of ORG ( PERSON ) and pointed out that his state of health would justify his retirement . ORG approved the dismissal on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered the applicant ’s dismissal on the ground that he was physically incapable of performing his functions as a police officer . It further ordered the immediate enforcement of its decision .

CARDINAL . By a letter dated DATE the applicant objected to the Police Headquarters’ notice of dismissal , giving as a reason that his state of health was a consequence of an occupational accident and was no fault of his own .

CARDINAL . On DATE he applied to ORG for reinstatement of the suspensive effect ( GPE der aufschiebenden PERSON ) of his objection in accordance with the relevant provisions of domestic law . ORG thereupon lifted the order for the immediate enforcement of the dismissal order by letter dated DATE .

CARDINAL . By a decision of CARDINAL DATE , which was served on the applicant on DATE , ORG dismissed the applicant ’s objection of DATE and reordered the immediate enforcement of the dismissal order of CARDINAL DATE . They found that the applicant ’s incapacity was not a consequence of the said car accident but of unrelated physical and mental conditions and that he was thus not eligible for retirement and to claim pension benefits .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a request for interim measures with ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE he brought an action against ORG with ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG reinstated the suspensive effect of the action against the dismissal order of CARDINAL DATE . ORG found that there was no prevailing public interest that could justify the immediate enforcement of the dismissal .

CARDINAL . On a complaint by ORG , ORG ( Oberverwaltungsgericht ) by a decision of DATE amended the decision of ORG and restricted the suspension of the said decisions to the effect that ORG was obliged to provisionally continue salary payments to the applicant in an amount equal to his pension entitlements and for the rest confirmed their immediate enforcement .
CARDINAL . By decisions of DATE and DATE ORG ordered expert opinions on the applicant ’s physical and mental condition , which were issued on DATE and DATE respectively .

CARDINAL . On DATE a hearing took place . By judgment of DATE ORG set aside the dismissal order of CARDINAL DATE . ORG found that the applicant ’s dismissal was unlawful and that he was entitled to retirement since his physical and mental disorders were a consequence of his occupational accident .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG lodged a request to be granted leave to appeal with ORG since there was no evidence that the applicant ’s incapacity had been caused by the occupational accident . ORG granted leave to appeal by decision of DATE which was served on the applicant on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered a neurological and a psychological expert opinion and on DATE a psychiatric expert opinion on the question as to whether the applicant ’s mental disorders had been caused by the occupational accident of CARDINAL DATE . The expert opinions were rendered on CARDINAL and DATE and on DATE respectively .
CARDINAL . On DATE a hearing took place on the occasion of which the experts explained their findings .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG set aside the judgment of ORG . It held that it was not established that the applicant ’s physical and mental troubles were related to the accident and dismissed the applicant ’s action .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a complaint against ORG refusal to grant him leave to appeal to ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( ORG ) rejected the applicant ’s complaint as inadmissible on the ground that the applicant had failed to substantiate his allegation that the proceedings had been flawed by procedural shortcomings that might have affected the decision of ORG . The decision was served on the applicant ’s counsel on DATE .
